settingsPane.description: You can change max and min frequencies of your device here. 1.190 GHz is the minimum limit of max frequency as below this frequency your device may suffer from high performance degradation. 1.036 GHz is the maximum limit of min frequency as above this frequency your device may not cool down. (Default: Max 2.265 GHz, Min 300 MHz) Please note scaling frequencies are dynamically changed by mpdecision. However, morpheus mode will try setting below values on screen on/off events.
settingsPane.name: CPU Frequency control

spinner.description: This sets maximum frequency of your device. Default 2.265 GHz.
spinner.name: Max CPU Frequency

spinner.description: This sets minimum frequency of your device. Default 300 MHz.
spinner.name: Min CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Use this to overclock CPU above max stock frequency. This feature will be activated only if Max CPU frequency is set to its max value. (2.265 GHz)
spinner.name: Overclock CPU

spinner.description: This sets maximum frequency of your device when screen is off.
spinner.name: Max CPU Suspend Frequency

spinner.description: This sets minimum frequency of your device when screen is off.
spinner.name: Min CPU Suspend Frequency

settingsPane.description: You can change governor of your device here. Governor decides current frequency of your device accordingly.
settingsPane.name: Governor control

spinner.description: This will set the active CPU governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the active CPU governor when screen is off.
spinner.name: Default CPU Sleep Governor

settingsPane.description: You can change CPU IO scheduler of your device here.
settingsPane.name: CPU IO Scheduler control

spinner.description: This will set the default IO scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard.
spinner.name: Default IO Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the default IO scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard when screen is off.
spinner.name: Default IO Sleep Scheduler

settingsPane.description: You can change GPU settings here and customize as per your use.
settingsPane.name: GPU Control

spinner.description: This will set maximum frequency GPU can attend. Default 450 MHz.
spinner.name: Max GPU frequency

spinner.description: This will set minimum frequency GPU can attend. Default 200 MHz.
spinner.name: Min GPU frequency

seekBar.description: This adjusts the number of times the governor polls for load. Lower == better performance (more battery drain) Default 10.
seekBar.name: Polling Interval

spinner.description: This will set the active GPU governor.
spinner.name: Default GPU Governor

settingsPane.description: OOM(Out of memory) is undesired state where no additional memory resources can be allocated. You can tune behavior of OOM Killer below.
settingsPane.name: OOM Killer

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using below profiles, disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via APP or Script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: AUTO OOM CONTROL

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

settingsPane.description: Settings for Dirty ratio and Dirty background ratio.
settingsPane.name: VM

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 15%)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

settingsPane.description: UKSM is new technique for KSM.
settingsPane.name: UKSM

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'Ultra KSM Control'. This will merge some memory but consumes more CPU and battery. You will need to reboot your device for changes to take effect.
checkbox.name: Ultra KSM Control
checkbox.label: Ultra KSM Control

button.description: Ultra KSM state check. Memory samepage merging is not quick process. So, stats may show 0 MB initially.
button.name: Ultra KSM STATS
button.label: Ultra KSM Stats

spinner.description: If enabled, turning the screen off with the power button disables s2w and dt2w to save battery. When you turn the screen back on, s2w and dt2w return to their previous settings. If the screen times out, s2w/dt2w are not disabled this is only if you use the power button to turn it off.
spinner.name: PKT

spinner.description: This option enables the doubletap2wake (AKA KnockKnock) feature (may cause more battery drain when in pocket)
spinner.name: DT2W

spinner.description: This option enables the sweep2wake/sweep2sleep feature. When screen is off, you can turn on by swiping LEFT to RIGHT and when screen on, swipe on the Navigation Bar from RIGHT to LEFT to turn off the screen.(may cause more battery drain when in pocket)
spinner.name: S2W/S2S

spinner.description: This option enables the sweep2sleep feature and disables sweep2wake feature functionally. When screen on, swipe on the Navigation Bar from RIGHT to LEFT to turn off the screen. This feature can be utilized only if S2W is enabled. You may combine 'S2S only' with DT2W.
spinner.name: S2S Only override

seekBar.description: This slider sets start position of S2W. Default 400.
seekBar.name: Start Position

seekBar.description: This slider sets start position of S2W. Default 700.
seekBar.name: Mid Position

seekBar.description: This slider sets start position of S2W. Default 830.
seekBar.name: End Position

seekBar.description: This slider sets threshold of S2W. Default 250.
seekBar.name: Threshold

spinner.description: This option selects orientation of S2W. Please note you will need adjust co-ordinates accordingly. Default Horizontal.
spinner.name: Orientation

settingsPane.description: Set temperature limits at which device starts throttling. Increasing these limits will increase performance of device at the cost of over heating.
settingsPane.name: Temperature Control

seekBar.description: This slider sets device temperature limit at which throttling will start. Stock 60. Recommended 70.
seekBar.name: Frequency Throttle Temperature

seekBar.description: This slider sets device temperature limit at which throttling will start when screen is off. Stock 60. Recommended 65.
seekBar.name: Frequency Throttle Suspend Temperature

seekBar.description: This slider sets core temperature limit at which throttling will start. Stock 80. Recommended 85.
seekBar.name: Core Throttle Temperature

seekBar.description: This slider sets core temperature limit at which throttling will start when screen is off. Stock 80. Recommended 80.
seekBar.name: Core Throttle Suspend Temperature

settingsPane.description: Set hysteresis value for temperature limits. When throttling temperature is reached, device will start throttling until temperature is reduced by hysteresis value. Do not change these values unless you are completely sure.
settingsPane.name: Hysteresis Control

seekBar.description: This slider sets hysteresis value for frequency throttle temperature. Stock 10. Recommended 5.
seekBar.name: Frequency Throttle Temperature Hysteresis

seekBar.description: This slider sets hysteresis value for core throttle temperature. Stock 10. Recommended 5.
seekBar.name: Core Throttle Temperature Hysteresis

seekBar.description: This slider sets number of frequency steps to be considered while throttling. Stock 2. Recommended 2.
seekBar.name: Frequency Stepping

settingsPane.description: This section controls kernel tweaks of the device.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable or Disable the background-process 'Morpheus'. If you disable it, you may lose the function that set different settings for screen state (ON or OFF). We recommend to leave this option enabled to protect CPU frequency overrides, save more power and more integrations coming soon.
spinner.name: Morpheus Mode

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable IPv6 Network. Depends on morpheus mode.
checkbox.name: IPv6 Tweaks
checkbox.label: IPv6

spinner.description: There are two color presets: stock and slightly cooler. When this option is enabled you will have slighly cooler and vivid color preset. For changes to take effect use power button to lock screen off and then on.
spinner.name: Color Tweak

seekBar.description: This slider helps increasing/decreasing vibrator strength. Default 75.
seekBar.name: Vibrator Strength

spinner.description: Sleeper Fairness is a concept used by CFS (Default task scheduler) which treat sleeping/waiting tasks as if they were in a run queue. This implies tasks which spend most of the time waiting for an user input and such will get a fair share of CPU when they need it. Disabling Gentle Fair Sleeper could improve UI responsiveness but may increase battery consumption to some level.
spinner.name: Gentle Fair Sleeper

spinner.description: Enable/Disable Dynamic File Sync. While screen is on, file sync is temporarily deferred, when screen is off, a flush is called to synchronize all outstanding writes. Please note: There may be loss of slight data if device reboots abruptly when Dynamic Fsync is enabled.
spinner.name: Dynamic FSync

spinner.description: Frandom is a Linux kernel random number generator which is 10-50 times faster than what you get from Linux built-in /dev/urandom. In case you face issue with wifi tethering or bluetooth connectivity you may try disabling this option and reboot. (Reboot required)
spinner.name: FRandom

spinner.description: This option allows some cheap USB chargers with > 500ma to be recognized as an AC charger in order to charge at a faster rate.
spinner.name: Fast Charge

spinner.description: Backlight dimmer allows you to adjust the LCD screen brightness lower than is possible with stock. Be careful, you can lower the brightness so much you can barely see it.
spinner.name: Backlight Dimmer

settingsPane.description: Cached RAM is RAM occupied by the applications and background process for faster loading of same.
settingsPane.name: Cached RAM

button.description: This will release all cached and buffered RAM
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: Clean RAM Buffer

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Here you can find GPS and NTP settings and options.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS-Time-Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS Zone Check

settingsPane.description: Here, you can load kernel modules on boot that will allow some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable Exfat module load on boot.
checkbox.name: EXFAT Module
checkbox.label: EXFAT Module

button.description: This displays the currently loaded modules.
button.name: Show Loaded Modules
button.label: Show Loaded Modules

button.description: This button tries to force-load selected modules in the memory without requiring a reboot. This may not help, because most modules requires a reboot. This button is primarily for testing purposes.
button.name: Force-Load Modules
button.label: Force-Load Modules
